title: PSA: deaths aren't "tanking"
body:
taking tons of damage and dieing in every fight doesn't mean you are tanking...plz stahp

edit: rofl the tanks are out in force. no surprise though the boards are full of carry op and 'member berries saying " 'member season X? oooohhh yea I 'member season X"

> [{quoted}](name=AmetDeCrypt,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JE52Qb5L,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-10-25T20:04:19.168+0000)
>
> {{champion:3}} would like his ult back.

galio could have it back but cc is a thing in the game
Tanking results in deaths when your "allies dont follow up."

The number of games I've won by going in 1v3 on an enemy team that overstayed to try to take an inhibitor turret after a won fight and died without killing any of them is literally in the dozens. 

Why? Because I'm jarvan 4 and they have no escape from my ult. those 4 extra seconds i kept 3 members stranded in my base at low health as my 4 allies respawned to kill them,  then proceed to 4v2 the enemy base or just take a free Baron - has definitely won me many games for a "suicide play". 

It also doesnt only apply to this scenario - any time i can trap 2+ important targets that my team can get on before my ult expires is typically an advantage even if i have to die for it.  Sure,  ideally I'd survive but few allies can keep up with a tp + e-q-r j4 play to help me out. 

Yes,  dying isn't ideal. A good tank will start the fight and use everything then get out with 10% health.  That can't always happen though - and if i can eat up 3+ ultimates while guaranteeing you're ability to reach the fight to clean up,  my death was worthwhile.

But if I rush ahead of the carries and 1v5 I'm being useful! I hate this anti-Tank circle jerk.
As long as they follow up then I'm useful. If no one follows up then it was a wasted effort.
